thread.title: MUST WATCH: Trump’s Immigration Order Brings Senate Minority Leader To TEARS…
thread.title_full: MUST WATCH: Trump’s Immigration Order Brings Senate Minority Leader To TEARS…

author: Nickarama
title: MUST WATCH: Trump’s Immigration Order Brings Senate Minority Leader To TEARS…
text:
10:38pm   
Senator Chuck Schumer (D-NY) showed up at JFK Airport in New York to protest   executive order ban. 
Schumer appeared before press with a family and cried, calling the executive orders, “mean-spirited and un-American.” Chuck Schumer's crying over Muslim refugees. 
After supporting the attack on Libya that led to the deaths of thousands of Muslim refugees. pic.twitter.com/vELee6v7cp 
— Paul Joseph Watson (@PrisonPlanet) January 29, 2017 We are going to fight these executive orders tooth & nail, for families like these & for all who still believe in the promise of America. pic.twitter.com/2cY3GbaTAc 
— Chuck Schumer (@SenSchumer) January 29, 2017 
No, mean-spirited and un-American is not adequately defending American citizens, which is supposed to be the primary responsibility of the President and members of Congress like Schumer. 
What was it when Obama actually blocked Iraqis from coming in for 6 months after he mistakenly let terrorists come in in 2011 through careless vetting? 
Was that “mean-spirited and un-American?” 
Why was there no outrage then? Where were Schumer’s tears then? 
Why were the people who were in greatest danger in Syria, the religiously persecuted, not prioritized under Obama? Was that “mean-spirited?” 
Why were the people who worked for the U.S. and were promised visas slow-walked by the Obama regime from getting those visas? So much so that some of them were killed while waiting? Was that “mean-spirited?” 
But people who could be not adequately vetted, even according to our FBI director, coming from places where ISIS was rampant, were allowed to enter. 
That obviously wasn’t “mean-spirited,” right? 
Perhaps Schumer can answer all these questions… LIKE this article?
